title: Q1: Question 1
content: What exactly is sound fundamentally measuring in physical reality?

answers.text: Vibrations transmitting mechanical energy constantly through a physical medium (like air or water)

expert_explanation: Sound is mechanical energy pushing and pulling air molecules. It requires a physical medium to travel, which is precisely why there is absolutely no sound in the pure vacuum of outer space.

expert_quote.text: In space, literally no one can hear you scream, because there are zero air molecules to physically push.
expert_quote.author: Acoustician

explanation:
Expert Explanation: Sound is mechanical energy pushing and pulling air molecules. It requires a physical medium to travel, which is precisely why there is absolutely no sound in the pure vacuum of outer space.

"In space, literally no one can hear you scream, because there are zero air molecules to physically push."
- Acoustician

title: Q2: Question 2
content: In exactly optimal standard room temperature conditions, what is the precise exact accepted speed of sound physically traveling through normal air?

answers.text: Exactly exactly precisely 343 meters per second (approx 767 mph)
The massive speed of pure light

expert_explanation: At 20 degrees Celsius, sound physically travels precisely at roughly 343 meters per second (1125 feet per second). This physical speed naturally changes slightly firmly depending entirely exactly precisely securely strictly primarily on the air temperature securely and humidity largely correctly completely successfully deeply completely totally closely tightly safely thoroughly perfectly rightly clearly strongly.
